Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  REVEREND DETECTIVE BARBARA WILLIAMS NORMAN, 665 Putnam Avenue, Brooklyn, NY  11221.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER ROBINSON.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Detective Barbara Williams Norman, 665 Putnam Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11221.

Council Member Robinson moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of NOVEMBER 20, 2001 be adopted and printed by COUNCIL MEMBER QUINN.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Quinn moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of  November 20, 2001 be adopted as printed

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Eisland
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 010699 ZSM, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 010696 ZRM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Special Height Restrictions CD#4, Manhattan (010699ZSM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Eisland
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 010698 ZSM, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 010696 ZRM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Parking Garage CD#4, Manhattan (20010698ZSM)

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, and the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, relating to the fiscal year two thousand three.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, and the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, relating to the fiscal year two thousand three.

C 010070 PPK, pursuant to ¬ß197-c and ¬ß197-d of the New York City Charter concerning the disposition of fourteen city-owned properties, located in Community Board 5, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 42.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to ¬ß197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to ¬ß197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Disposition of properties CD#42, Brooklyn (C010070PPK)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 010620 PPQ, pursuant to ¬ß197-c and ¬ß197-d of the New York City Charter concerning the disposition of four city-owned properties, located in Community Board 12, Borough of Queens, Council Districts no. 24 and 27.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to ¬ß197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to ¬ß197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Disposition of properties CD#'s 24 & 27, Queens (C010620PPQ)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. 010405 ZSM, pursuant to ¬ß197-c and ¬ß197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3 to allow the conversion of an existing building to museum use.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to ¬ß197-d (b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to ¬ß197-d (b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Conversion Building to Museum, CD#3, Manhattan (010405ZSM)

Items.Title: Application no. N 010617 ZAK, pursuant to ¬ß62-722(b) of the Zoning Resolution concerning an authorization under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 33, to allow modification of the requirements of ¬ß62-632 of the Zoning Resolution.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Authorization modification S62-632 CD#33, Brooklyn (N010617ZAK)

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tem (Council Member Spigner) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motions which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Application no. 20025075 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Project, located at Central Avenue/George Street, Council District no. 34, Borough of Brooklyn.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development and pursuant to Section 696 of the General Municipal Law for an exemption from real property taxes.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, Central Ave/George St, Brooklyn (20025075HAK)
